alert.note: Alert for Sweetwater (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 08 at 2:16PM MST until February 08 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... West central Sweetwater County in south central Wyoming... * Until 245 PM MST. * At 215 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 9 miles west of Green River, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 64 and 101. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Rock Springs, Green River and Little America. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Serious injuries and deaths may result from people exiting their vehicles during a snow squall. Drivers may not be able to see you or stop! If you have been involved in an accident or pulled to the side of the roadway, quickly exit your vehicle and move as far away from the roadway as possible ONLY when it is safe to do so. Do not stand along or near the roadway, since approaching vehicles may be unable to maintain control. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
